            Ovande Furtado
          
          
            
              Welcome to my academic blog. I am an associate professor at Cal State Northridge where I teach courses related to Kinesiology. I earned my M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Motor Behavior from the University of Pittsburgh, PA. Dr. My line of research focuses on two main areas: (1) validation of observational models in psychomotor assessment instruments and (2) the relationship between motor skill competence, perceived motor competence, physical activity levels, and body composition.
              I often post on the topics related to: a) Statistics, b) SPSS and R Software, c) Online teaching, d) Motor Behavior, e) Motor skill assessment.
              If you are a student interested in gaining experience with research, contact me for more information.
              If you landed here while searching for my academic site, click here to be redirected.
              If you enjoy the content of this blog, please consider supporting what I do. Thank you.
